albsavoia wrote:

>  >but I just dislike quite strongly the way
>  > you present these ideas.
> 
> Given how careful I've tried to be with my language this surprises me.
> Other than the two mentions of dogma which I addressed in the
> previous post, what other presentation of ideas do you dislike?
> Please let me know because this kind of feedback is very useful.

I might be overgeneralizing. Let me state it better: I dislike it when 
you bring dogma into the discussion, as it weakens--for me--the power 
and credibility of the underlying ideas. It's as though they aren't 
strong enough to merit consideration without assuming the intent of the 
"other side".

> As a matter of fact, thank you for taking the time to comment on it.
> Testivus is meant to start discussions, not to end them :-).

Absolutely. Still, I think I would prefer the Testivus message if it 
were, rather than apposite to dogma, more a message of "not everyone has 
a clear mental model of how this works; many of us struggle with it; 
here are some talking points or pointers that will help those in that 
position." Of course, you'd need to make it far less condescending than 
I just did. Call it a draft. :)
